datafield.subfield: Milke and hony, or a miscellanious collation of many Christian experien[c]es, sayinges contentes and severall pleases [=places] of scripturs improved :
Unrestricted, for either reading room or classroom use.

Copied by M. Gordone; below his signature on the front pastedown is a note scriptum Dunrobinibus dated 1659 April 9. Dunrobin Castle was the family seat of the Gordons, the Earls of Sutherland; they also held lands in Aberdeenshire.

Includes only the first forty paragraphs of Venning's original, first published in London, printed by T.[homas] R.[atcliffe] & E.[dward] M.[ottershed] for John Rothwel, 1653. Followed by an unidentified commentary on several passages from the Gospel of Matthew in a disputation format, and concludes with eight theses and refutations in Latin concerning revelation, the covenants, incarnation, and the rational spirit.

MS 3327, Container 84: From the Gibson-Craig Collection (paper slip tipped-in on inside front cover); acquired by the Ransom Center (R5374) in 1973 from Jenkins and Company. Binding: Full brown tanned sheepskin over paper boards. Straight (?) caps, cut-solid edges red sprinkled, tight back, smooth spine. Blind-tooled two-line borders, front and back covers, worn double (?) lines blind-tooled across spine, remnant of paper label head end of spine. Two fastenings fore edge: front cover - brown tanned animal skin straps/metal hooks; back cover metal bar catchplates. No title, no endbands. Sewn on three alum-tawed thongs laced on boards. Endleaf components: front no endleaves, one text blank; back no endleaves, three text blanks.
Medieval and Early Modern Manuscripts Collection.
